feedback.everything_correct: Wow, you've clearly spent some quality time in the jungle! You got everything correct, just like a dolphin acing an echolocation test. Your knowledge of animal facts is so profound that even a parrot would find it hard to keep up with you. Keep up the excellent work, and remember to wear a helmet; a jealous woodpecker might be around the corner.
feedback.very_good: Fantastic! Your performance is as flashy as a peacock's tail. It seems like you've got a memory as strong as an elephant's. Sure, you missed a few, but nobody's perfect. Well, except for maybe the platypus, nature's most unlikely creature.
feedback.good: Not bad, not bad at all. You're as sharp as an eagle's eye. Sure, a few questions slipped past you like a ninja octopus, but overall, you have a fair amount of knowledge in that noggin of yours. Keep learning and maybe you'll be as wise as an owl one day.
feedback.bad: Well, it looks like you tripped up a bit there, kind of like a penguin on a banana peel. But don't let it get you down. Remember, a kangaroo doesn't start hopping right away, either. Keep learning and soon you'll be swinging through these quizzes like a chimpanzee in the jungle.
feedback.very_bad: Oh dear, your score is a bit like a fish out of water. But don't worry, even a tortoise finishes the race eventually. It seems the animal kingdom is a bit of a lion's den for you right now, but with a bit of practice, you'll be soaring like an eagle in no time.
feedback.everything_wrong: Well, looks like you've stumbled more than a newborn giraffe. Don't worry though, even a blind squirrel finds a nut sometimes. Brush up on your animal facts, and remember, every dog has its day. Next time, you might just make a comeback like a phoenix rising from the ashes.

questions.question: What is the only bird known to fly backward?
questions.explanation: Hummingbirds are the only birds that can fly backward. They have a unique ball and socket joint at the shoulder that allows them to rotate their wings 180 degrees in all directions.

questions.question: What type of animal is a Komodo Dragon?
questions.explanation: Komodo Dragons are a type of monitor lizard, which are large lizards found throughout Africa, Asia and Australia.

questions.question: Which mammal lays eggs?
questions.explanation: Platypuses are one of the few mammals that lay eggs. They, along with echidnas, are monotremes – a type of mammal that lays eggs instead of giving birth to live young.

questions.question: What is the world's largest land carnivore?
questions.explanation: The Polar Bear is the world's largest land carnivore and also the largest bear. They can weigh over 1,500 pounds and measure over 9 feet tall when standing on their hind legs.

questions.question: Which animal has the longest lifespan?
questions.explanation: The Bowhead Whale is known to live over 200 years. The oldest known Bowhead lived to be 211 years old.

questions.question: Which animal is capable of true flight?
questions.explanation: Bats are the only mammals that are capable of sustained flight. Other mammals like flying squirrels and flying lemurs can only glide or parachute; the longest recorded flight of a flying squirrel is 90 meters.

questions.question: Which animal has the most hearts?
questions.explanation: An Octopus has three hearts. Two of the hearts work exclusively to move blood beyond the animal’s gills, while the third keeps circulation flowing for the organs.

questions.question: Which animal has the most legs?
questions.explanation: Some species of millipedes have more than 400 legs, far more than any other animal.

questions.question: Which animal has the largest brain?
questions.explanation: The Sperm Whale has the largest brain of any animal, more than five times heavier than a human's.

questions.question: Which bird creates the largest nest?
questions.explanation: The largest bird nest was built by a pair of Bald Eagles, and was 20 feet deep, 9.5 feet wide, and weighed over two tons.

questions.question: What is the world's smallest fish?
questions.explanation: The smallest fish in the world is the Paedocypris. Females measure just 7.9mm long, while males only grow to 10.3mm.

questions.question: Which animal has the strongest bite in the animal kingdom?
questions.explanation: The Saltwater Crocodile has the strongest bite force ever recorded for an animal. The largest recorded bite force is over 3,700 pounds per square inch.

questions.question: What is the world's largest rodent?
questions.explanation: The Capybara is the largest rodent in the world, they can weigh up to 145 pounds.

questions.question: Which animal can sleep while flying?
questions.explanation: Frigatebirds can sleep while flying in 7-12 second bursts, a phenomenon known as 'microsleep'.

questions.question: Which animal is the tallest in the world?
questions.explanation: Giraffes are the tallest animals in the world. Males can grow up to 18 feet tall and females can reach 14 feet tall.

questions.question: What is the largest species of shark?
questions.explanation: Whale Sharks are the largest species of shark, and the largest fish in the ocean. They can grow up to 40 feet long, but despite their size, they are gentle giants that feed mostly on plankton.

questions.question: What is the fastest land animal?
questions.explanation: Cheetahs are the fastest land animals, capable of reaching speeds up to 60-70 miles per hour. They can accelerate from 0 to 60 miles an hour in just a few seconds.

questions.question: Which bird is known as the 'Bird of Paradise'?
silly_answers: A penguin with a party hat
questions.explanation: The Raggiana Bird-of-paradise is a bird in the Paradisaeidae family. Male Raggiana Birds-of-paradise are known for their extravagant courtship displays and brightly colored plumage.

questions.question: What is the largest land animal?
questions.explanation: The African Elephant is the largest land animal. They can weigh up to 14,000 pounds and stand up to 13 feet tall at the shoulder.

questions.question: Which animal is known for its unique black and white coat?
questions.explanation: Pandas are known for their black and white coats. Their distinctive coloration is thought to provide effective camouflage in their snowy and rocky habitat.

questions.question: What is the tallest bird in the world?
questions.explanation: The Ostrich is the tallest bird in the world, with an average height of 6 to 9 feet. Despite its height, it is also the fastest bird on land.

questions.question: What is the heaviest bird capable of flight?
questions.explanation: The Kori Bustard is the heaviest bird that can fly. It can weigh up to 44 pounds. Despite its weight, it prefers to walk or run on the ground.

questions.question: What is the largest reptile in the world?
questions.explanation: The Saltwater Crocodile is the largest living reptile in the world, with males reaching lengths of up to 6 to 7 meters.

questions.question: Which bird can recognize itself in a mirror?
questions.explanation: The European Magpie is one of the few non-mammal species able to recognize itself in a mirror test. This indicates a certain level of self-awareness.

questions.question: What is the national bird of New Zealand?
questions.explanation: The Kiwi is the national bird of New Zealand. It's a flightless bird, and is also the smallest Ratite.

questions.question: What animal has the highest blood pressure?
questions.explanation: A giraffe's blood pressure is the highest of any animal, needed to pump blood up to its long neck. It's twice as high as a human's.

questions.question: What is the smallest breed of dog?
silly_answers: A dog that got shrunk in the wash
questions.explanation: The Chihuahua is the smallest breed of dog. They weigh as little as 2 pounds and stand about 5 inches high.

questions.question: What animal never sleeps?
questions.explanation: Bullfrogs do not sleep. While they do have rest periods where they remain absolutely still with their eyes closed, they do not enter a true sleep state.

questions.question: What is the largest species of penguin?
silly_answers: A king penguin with a superiority complex
A regular penguin in a tuxedo
questions.explanation: The Emperor Penguin is the tallest and heaviest of all living penguin species and is endemic to Antarctica.

questions.question: What is the most poisonous fish in the world?
silly_answers: A goldfish with a bad attitude
questions.explanation: The Stonefish is the most venomous fish in the world. Its dorsal area is lined with 13 spines, each of which has two venom sacs.

questions.question: Which bird has the largest brain relative to its size?
silly_answers: An owl wearing a graduation cap
questions.explanation: Ravens are extremely intelligent and have one of the largest brains of any bird species. They are capable of complex problem-solving and can even mimic human speech.

questions.question: What is the slowest fish in the world?
silly_answers: A fish on a leisurely stroll
A fish with no sense of direction
A fish late for an appointment
questions.explanation: The Seahorse is the slowest fish, swimming at about 0.01 mph.

questions.question: Which animal has the most legs?
silly_answers: An octopus with a leg extension
questions.explanation: Millipedes hold the record for most legs among the animal kingdom. Some species can have up to 750 legs.

questions.question: What is the only bird known to fly backwards?
questions.explanation: Hummingbirds are the only birds that can fly backwards and even upside down, thanks to their unique wing structure.

questions.question: What bird is known as a symbol of peace?
silly_answers: A hawk with a olive branch
An ostrich with a white flag
questions.explanation: The Dove, often in white, has been a symbol of peace and innocence for thousands of years across many different cultures.

questions.question: Which animal is known to have 32 brains?
silly_answers: A chameleon with an identity crisis
questions.explanation: Each segment of a leech's body has its own brain, hence a leech technically has 32 brains.

questions.question: Which insect is known for its light-producing organ?
silly_answers: A glow worm with a torch
A lightning bug with LED lights
questions.explanation: Fireflies, or lightning bugs, produce light in their light organs located in their abdomen. This bioluminescence is used to attract mates or prey.

questions.question: Which animal has the longest gestation period?
silly_answers: A snail that's very slow in everything
questions.explanation: Elephants have the longest gestation period of all animals. They are pregnant for up to 22 months.

questions.question: Which bird has the widest wingspan?
silly_answers: A penguin with delusions of grandeur
A peacock on a hang glider
questions.explanation: The Wandering Albatross holds the record for largest wingspan of any bird, it can reach up to 11 feet.

questions.question: What animal is known for changing its color to blend with its surroundings?
silly_answers: A flamingo in a paint shop
A giraffe in a striped pyjama
questions.explanation: Chameleons are known for their ability to change their skin color. This can happen in response to changes in light, temperature, and mood.

questions.question: What is the largest land animal?
silly_answers: A tortoise with a superiority complex
questions.explanation: The African Elephant is the largest land animal. They can weigh up to 14,000 pounds.

questions.question: What animal has the highest blood pressure?
silly_answers: A squirrel with a coffee addiction
questions.explanation: Giraffes have the highest blood pressure among animals due to the long distance between their heart and brain.

questions.question: What is the smallest mammal in the world?
questions.explanation: The smallest mammal in the world by length is the bumblebee bat, also known as Kitti's hog-nosed bat. It measures just 1.1-1.3 inches long.

questions.question: What bird is known for its elaborate courtship dance?
silly_answers: A seagull at a salsa party
questions.explanation: Male peacocks perform an elaborate courtship dance where they fan out their large, colorful tail feathers and shake them.

questions.question: What animal is the symbol of the World Wildlife Fund (WWF)?
silly_answers: An armadillo wearing a world champion belt
questions.explanation: The Giant Panda has been the symbol of the World Wildlife Fund since its inception in 1961.

questions.question: What mammal is capable of true flight?
questions.explanation: Bats are the only mammals that are capable of sustained flight. Other mammals like the flying squirrel can only glide or parachute.

questions.question: What bird is known for its laughing call?
questions.explanation: The Kookaburra, native to Australia, is known for its distinctive 'laughing' call, which is often used in films to suggest a jungle environment.

questions.question: Which animal is the smallest breed of dog?
silly_answers: A Great Dane with low self-esteem
A Labrador in a funhouse mirror
A mastiff who identifies as tiny
questions.explanation: The Chihuahua is the smallest breed of dog and is named after the Mexican state of Chihuahua.

questions.question: What is the world's largest reptile?
silly_answers: A chameleon with a growth spurt
A python after swallowing a beach ball
An iguana with a tall tale
questions.explanation: The Saltwater Crocodile is the largest living reptile in the world, with males reaching lengths of up to 6-7 meters.

questions.question: What animal has the largest eyes in the world?
questions.explanation: The Giant Squid has the largest eyes in the animal kingdom. Each eye can be up to 10 inches in diameter.

questions.question: What is the tallest breed of dog in the world?
silly_answers: A Dachshund with delusions of grandeur
questions.explanation: The Great Dane is known for its giant size. The record holder for tallest dog was a Great Dane named Zeus who stood at 44 inches tall.

questions.question: What is the largest species of shark?
silly_answers: A goldfish with a superiority complex
questions.explanation: The Whale Shark is the largest species of shark and the largest fish alive today. They can grow up to 40 feet in length.

questions.question: What animal has the longest tail?
silly_answers: A rat with a long story
A fox with a feather duster
questions.explanation: The Giraffe has the longest tail of any land mammal. Their tail can be up to 8 feet long, including the tuft at the end.

questions.question: What is the world's heaviest flying bird?
questions.explanation: The Great Bustard, found in Europe and Asia, is the heaviest living bird capable of flight. Males can weigh between 10-16 kg (22-40 lbs).
